channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Distress Investing: Crime Scene Investigation
item.description: In the underbelly of private markets lies the main culprit behind corporate failures: defective capital structuring.

item.title: Montana miner laying off 700 as price for metal used in catalytic converters collapses
item.description: The price of the precious metal palladium was about $2,300 an ounce two years ago and has dipped below $1,000 an ounce over the past three months.

item.title: Fani Willis likely to defy Georgia state Senate subpoena ahead of hearing Friday, chairman says
item.description: District Attorney Fani Willis is expected to defy a Georgia state senate subpoena for her testimony ahead of a hearing Friday, Fox News has learned.

item.title: The Real Scandal in Springfield, Ohio
item.description: The cats and dogs may be safe and sound, but all is not right in Springfield.

item.title: First Ballots Mailed Out Closer To The Biden-Harris Switcheroo Than Election Day
item.description: As ballots started to go out in the mail this week, Kamala Harris' presidential candidacy had yet to hit its halfway mark.

item.title: Revisiting the Factor Zoo: How Time Horizon Impacts the Efficacy of Investment Factors
item.description: Don't ignore serial dependencies in your factor portfolio.

item.title: Air Canada makes plea for government help as pilots demand wages it says it can’t pay
item.description: The union representing 5,200 pilots says Air Canada continues to post record profits while expecting pilots to accept below-market compensation.

item.title: House GOP rolling out bill to block China from accessing US ports
item.description: FIRST ON FOX: GOP Rep. Michelle Steele is rolling out a bill to block China and other American adversaries from accessing U.S. ports.

item.title: Trump’s Terrible Tariffs
item.description: Perhaps the strongest indictment of his trade policies is that Joe Biden looked at them and thought they were worth continuing.

item.title: New York Times: It’s OK To ‘Help’ Your Mentally Incapacitated Relatives Complete Their Ballots
item.description: The New York Times said even if it is unclear whether someone is mentally capable, 'err on the side of helping someone to vote.'

item.title: How Machine Learning Is Transforming Portfolio Optimization
item.description: Using machine learning algorithms in portfolio optimization is a growing trend that investors should pay attention to.

item.title: Hewlett-Packard boss says pursuing Mike Lynch’s grieving family for $4 billion was a ‘difficult decision’ done in ‘the best interests of shareholders’
item.description: Hewlett-Packard CEO Antonio Neri expressed regret for Lynch's death while doubling down on his company's legal battle.

item.title: FirstEnergy ordered to pay $100 million for its role in scheme to bribe state officials

item.title: Not every company is struggling in China: Brands like Sam’s Club and Lululemon win over more ‘rational’ consumers
item.description: While most brands struggle with sluggish demand, a select few consumer companies are delivering gains last seen during China's boom times.

item.title: Kirby’s Reply-All Rebuff Of Veterans Confirms The Biden Administration’s Disdain For Our Military
item.description: Biden, Harris, and Kirby, not Trump, are the ones who repeatedly show contempt for men and women who have risked their lives for the country.
